intro: Tephrosia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower tephrosia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, round pods that contain seeds. Tephrosia uniflora is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
